document.heading: Regional Interstate Banking Act of 1985 Temporary Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-261, the “Regional Interstate Banking Act of 1985 Temporary Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-732. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 15, 1992, and January 5, 1993, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 25, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 9-409 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-261 became effective on March 27, 1993.
